verses.roman:
pitar yuvābhyāṁ snigdhābhyāṁ
poṣitau lālitau bhṛśam
pitror abhyadhikā prītir
ātmajeṣv ātmano 'pi hi

synonyms: pitaḥ—O Father; yuvābhyām—by you two; snigdhābhyām—affectionate; poṣitau—maintained; lālitau—coddled; bhṛśam—thoroughly; pitroḥ—for parents; abhyadhikā—greater; prītiḥ—love; ātmajeṣu—for their children; ātmanaḥ—than for themselves; api—even; hi—indeed.
translation: [Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma said:] O Father, you and mother Yaśodā have affectionately maintained Us and cared for Us so much! Indeed, parents love their children more than their own lives.
